div.l: Wel hath this myller vernysshed his hed
Ful pale he was for dronkyn / and nat red
He yexeth and speketh throuh the nose
As he wer on the quakke / or on the pose
To bed he goth / and wyth him goth his wyf
As any Iay she lyht was and Iolyf
So was hir Ioly whistil / wel y wet
The cradell / at hir beddis fet she set
To rokken and to yve the chylde sowke
And whanne that dronken / was al in the crowke
To bedde went the douhtir / ryht a noon
To bedde goth Aleyn̄ / and also Iohn
Ther was no more / hem neded no dwale
This myller͗e hath so wysely / bibbed ale
That as an hors / he fnorteth in his slepe
Ne of his taile behynde / he took no kepe
His wyf bar him a burdoıı̄un / a ful strong
Men myhten / her Rouhtyng here a furlong
The wenche routeth eek / par companye
Aleyn the Clerke / that herd this melodye
He poked Iohn̄ and seid slepyst thou
Herdyst thou evir / swylk a song or nowe
Loo swylk a couplyng / is a melle hem alle
A wylde fyer mot on her bodyer falle
Who herkened ever / swylk a ferly thyng
They sal haue the flour / of ille endyng
This long nyht ther tydes me noanona rest
But yit no forse / al sal be for the best
For Iohn̄ seide he / alswa mot I thryve
Yif that y may / yon̄ wenche wol I swyve
